Exaggerate: The claim that Canada was 'free' of COVID-19 in August 2020 is an exaggeration, as there were still active cases and deaths reported during that time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts the official data provided by the Canadian government, which reported active cases and deaths due to COVID-19.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Canada had recorded daily average COVID-19 cases and deaths, as reported by the Canadian government and the chief public health officer.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Canada was completely free of COVID-19 based on a Facebook post, without considering the official data and reports.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the Facebook post was misinformed or spreading misinformation, leading to the false claim of Canada being 'free' of COVID-19.
Understate: The claim understates the presence of COVID-19 in Canada by ignoring the reported active cases and deaths, thus giving a false impression of the situation.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not acknowledging the ongoing presence and impact of COVID-19 in Canada, as stated by the Canadian government and health officials.
